result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Alan L Brown was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Must attend the Victim Impact Panel on 3-15-2016

records.addlTxt:
8:33 Defendant Alan L Brown in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Attorney Zenor regarding traffic citation.  Defendant enters plea for 14TR2168.  Attorney Zenor brings motion regarding blood draw. Court denies motion. 
8:38 Attorney Zell puts prior convictions on the record. Attorney Zenor agrees with prior convictions. Defendant stipulates to 4 prior OWI convictions. 
8:45 Parties review jury instructions. Court takes 10 minute recess. 
8:58 Court reconvenes. Jury brought into courtroom. 
9:05 Jurors sworn in and 20 jurors called to box. 
9:07 Voir Dire by court. 
9:12 Voir Dire by Attorney Zell
9:25 Voir Dire by Attorney Zenor
9:33 Court gives instructions to jurors.  Parties begin strikes. 
9:40 12 jurors selected and sworn in. Jurors excused for break.  Court takes 10 minute recess. 
9:57 Court reconvenes.  Jurors called back to courtroom. 
10:00 Opening statement by Attorney Zell. 
10:04 Opening statement by Attorney Zenor. 
10:06 Attorney Zell calls Cody Conover.  Witness sworn in and testifies.  Testifies he was an officer with the Pittsville Police Department at time of incident involving defendant.  Testifies to responding to accident involving defendant. Exhibit 1 - Map of intersection where accident took place. 
10:13 Cross by Attorney Zenor. Testifies when he arrived on the scene, the defendant was being attended to by medical personnel.  Testifies he obtained the defendant's wallet at some point during the incident. 
10:16 Exhibit 1 received. 
10:17 Attorney Zell calls Kathy Krohn as witness.  Witness sworn in and testifies.  Witness testifies to employment with Marshfield Hospital. Exhibit 2 - Blood collection document. Testifies to taking blood sample from defendant. 
10:20 Cross by Attorney Zenor.  Witness testifies to location she was at when she took defendant's blood. Witness excused. 10:22 Exhibit 2 received by court. 
10:22 Attorney Zell calls Daniel McManaway as witness.  Witness testifies to employment with the state laboratory.  Exhibit 3 - Report from State Laboratory.  Testifies to testing defendant's blood. Testifies to blood results. 
10:33 Cross by Attorney Zenor. Witness testifies to receiving sample by mail. Testifies to how blood results were determined. 
10:38 Redirect by Attorney Zell. 
10:40 Recross by Attorney Zenor. 
10:43 Attorney Zell requests a recess.  Court in recess for 10 minutes. Court excuses jurors. 
10:57 Court reconvenes.  Jurors called back to courtroom. 
10:58 Attorney Zell calls Chris Zawislan as witness. Witness sworn in and testifies.  Testifies to being employed as a trooper with the Wisconsin State Patrol.  Testifies to having experience responding to alcohol related incidents. Testifies he responded to the incident involving the defendant. Witness identifies defendant in the court. Witness testifies to communicating with defendant at scene of accident. Testifies to mailing blood samples to state laboratory. Exhibit 4 - Disc of photos from scene. Witness identifies photos.  Exhibit 5 - Accident report.  Exhibits 4 and 5 received. 
11:17 Cross by Attorney Zenor. Testifies to seeing the defendant wearing a helmet when he arrived on the scene. Testifies he did not have a warrant for the blood draw. Testifies to injuries he observed on defendant. Witness testifies to length and location of tire marks on highway and in ditch. 
11:29 Redirect by Attorney Zell.  
11:30 Court has jury leave the courtroom.  Attorney Zenor motions to dismiss.  Motion denied. 
11:33 Attorney Zenor calls Steve Fredrickson as witness. Witness sworn in and testifies.  Witness testifies to employment. Testifies to being defendant's neighbor. Testifies to visiting defendant while he was in the hospital and observing his injuries.  Attorney Zell objects to questioning. 
11:41 Court orders jurors be removed from courtroom to allow parties to discuss legal issues. Court questions Attorney Zenor regarding questioning. Court questions witness. Attorney Zenor has no further questions of this witness.  Attorney Zell has no cross examination for this witness. Court excuses this witness. 
11:47 Court questions defendant regarding his testimony. Attorney Zenor requests break to allow time for discussion with defendant.  Attorney Zell requests witness Fredrickson remains in courtroom during trial. Court orders witness to remain in courtroom.  11:49 court takes 10 minute recess. 
12:02 Court reconvenes.  Court questions Attorney Zenor regarding the defendant testifying. Court finds the defendant's decision to testify is entered freely and voluntarily.  Court instructs bailiff to release jurors for lunch.  Court to reconvene at 1:10 p.m.
1:11 Court reconvenes. 
1:12 Jurors return to courtroom. 
1:14 Attorney Zenor calls Alan Brown as witness.  Witness sworn in and testifies.  Testifies to remembering portions of the crash.  Testifies he drank from a bottle after the crash happened. Testifies he doesn't remember having the EMT's talk to him. 
1:21 Cross by Attorney Zell.  Witness testifies he does not know what type of alcohol was in the bottle he drank. Testifies he has been convicted of a crime in the past. 
1:23 Redirect by Attorney Zenor.  
1:25 Recross by Attorney Zell. 
1:26 Attorney Zenor recalls Steve Fredrickson.
1:33 Cross by Attorney Zell. 
1:35 Redirect by Attorney Zenor.  Question asked is stricken. 
1:36 Attorney Zell presents rebuttal evidence. Recalls Trooper Zawislan.  Exhibit 6 - squad video. Witness testifies to the information in the video.
1:45 Cross by Attorney Zenor.
1:46 Redirect by Attorney Zell.  
1:46 Exhibit 6 received. 
1:47 Attorney Zenor recalls Alan Brown.  Witness testifies the date he recovered his scooter after his release from the hospital.  Witness does not remember speaking to anyone at the scene. 
1:49 Both parties rest. Court excuses the jury from courtroom during instruction conference. Both parties review jury instructions.  No objections by either party. 
1:59 Court takes recess to prepare jury instructions and to allow parties time for closing arguments.  
2:24 Court reconvenes.  There are no objections to the jury instructions.  Jury returns to courtroom. 
2:26 Court reads instructions to the jury. 
2:41 Attorney Zell makes closing arguments. 
2:55 Attorney Zenor makes closing arguments. 
3:05 Rebuttal by Attorney Zell. 
3:09 Charge to jury. 
3:14 Oath to bailiffs Dave Hoks and Bill Jacobs. 
3:15 Jury released to jury room for deliberation.
3:59 Jurors return to courtroom with verdict. 
4:01 Court reads verdict.  Defendant found guilty.  Court questions jury regarding verdict reached.  Attorney Zenor asks for individual poll of jury.  
4:04 Court excuses jurors. 
4:06 Bond is revoked. Court questions parties about proceeding to sentencing.  Court will proceed to sentencing.
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-29-2016 08:30 am
Defendants
cover letter from Attorney Zenor
Process Servers Worksheet
Jury trial - 12 person at 10-07-2015 08:30 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 05-28-2015 08:30 am
cover letter from Attorney Zenor
Jury trial - 12 person on April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

11:30 Defendant Alan L Brown in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court takes up Motions in Limine.

Motion 1 - Atty Zenor would like Jury Questionnaires available a few days prior to trial.  Court grants however it will need to be arranged with the Clerk of Courts Office.

Motion 2 -  Sequesteration of witnesses.  State does not object except for Court Officer.  Court so orders.

Motion 3 - Individual Voir Dire.  Only if necessary.

Motion 4 - That defense be allowed to submit Jury Instruction.  To be provided by at least a day or two before the trial.

Motion 5 - Jury Panel Instruction regarding elements of substantive instructions, burden of proof, roles of defense counsel and counsel's duty to object during proceedings.  Court will read Jury Instruction 50 and substantive instruction on the crime.

Motion 6 - Prosecution prohibited from entering other acts evidence by the defendant.  Granted

Motion 7 - Prohibition from use or mention of physical evidence not previously disclosed.  Granted

Motion 8 - Prohibition from introducint lay opinion or expert testimony and scientific expert testimony as outlined in Daubert hearing.  Court addresses decision on HGN.  Atty Lambert questions blood testing.  Atty Zenor will stipulate.

Motion 9 - Court to establish orderly procedures regarding offer of proof, objections and motions.  Court expects counsel to be civil. 

Motion 10 - Court Reporter to record all proceedings except jury instruction meetings, sidebars until after jury is removed.  Granted

Motion 11 - Admissibility of heresay.  Atty Lambert does not intend to offer improper evidence.  Rules of evidence are followed.  Law will be followed.

Motion 12 - Counsel prohibited from referring to or moving into evidence anything not previousely disclosed.  No objection by State.  Granted.

Motion 13 - Prohibition for calling witnesses not disclosed.  Granted

Motion 14 - Prohibit prosecution from introducing inflammatory evidence, physical evidence including photos and video recordings.  Not granted because not needed.

Motion 15 - Reference to or use of statements made by the defendant.  Court believes motion should be brought if Atty Zenor believes it will be a problem.  Atty Lambert agrees.  Atty Zenor argues reports that indicate that Brown was combative.  Atty Lambert agrees except Police Reports are not a verbatim statement.  Court clarifies.

Motion 16 - Handling of objections.  Court will handle as ruling on objection right away.

Motion 17 - Right to bring additional Motions in Limine.  Court grants.

Atty Zenor to get a new trial date.  Bond is continued.
